title: Master Class : technical interviews
description: TLearn how to approach coding interviews with strategy and confidence. Get tips from industry experts on solving real interview problems.
whatThisSessionCovers: The structure of technical interviews (Rounds, Patterns & Expectations)
How to approach DSA problems step-by-step
Common coding question patterns used in top companies
How to explain your thought process clearly during interviews
Tips to write clean and optimized code
Behavioral interview guidance: HR + cultural fit questions
Red flags to avoid during interviews
keyTakeaways: Learn the mindset interviewers look for
Understand how to break down complex problems
Practice techniques to handle pressure during live coding
Build confidence in presenting your solutions
Improve your communication while explaining your logic
whyMatters: Technical interviews are not only about solving problems—they are about how you think, how you communicate, and how efficiently you approach solutions.

title: Master Class : Advanced Java Concepts
description: Go beyond the basics — explore multi-threading, collections, and frameworks that make Java enterprise-ready..
whyMatters: A strong knowledge of Java internals helps build reliable and high-performance systems.

title: Master Class : React for Professionals
description: Build scalable, high-performance web apps with advanced React techniques, hooks, and state management tools.
whyMatters: Modern React apps require architecture that scales across teams and features.

title: Master Class : DSA Problem Solving
description: Master the art of breaking complex problems into simple solutions using effective data structures and algorithms.
whyMatters: DSA is fundamental for algorithmic thinking required in interviews and product-level problems.

title: Master Class : UI/UX Design Thinking
description: Understand how great digital experiences are created. Learn research, wireframing, and prototyping like a professional designer.
keyTakeaways: Apply design thinking in real products
whyMatters: Good product design creates delightful and usable products that users love.
